contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=January 2013}} In [[telecommunication]], a '''complementary network service''' (CNS) is a means for an enhanced-service provider customer to connect to a [[telecommunications network|network]] and to the [[enhanced service]] provider. Complementary network services usually consist of the customer local service, such as a business or residence, and several associated service features, such as a [[telephone call|call]]-forwarding service. ==References== {{FS1037C}} [[Category:Telephone service enhanced features]] {{telecomm-stub}}
